conclusion: The displacement of an object can be found by calculating the area under its v-t graph.
If the v-t graph is above the t-axis, the area represents positive displacement. If the v-t graph is below the t-axis, the area represents negative displacement.
The v-t graph shows two curves, one labeled A and the other labeled B, both above the t-axis and spanning from 0 to t1. Curve A is always above curve B.

premise: The displacement of an object can be found by calculating the area under its v-t graph.
conclusion: The area under the curve for object A represents the total displacement of object A, and the area under the curve for object B represents the total displacement of object B.

premise: The difference in displacement between two objects is given by the difference in the areas under their v-t graphs up to a given time.
conclusion: The difference in displacement between objects A and B at any time t is the difference in the areas under their respective v-t graphs up to that time.

premise: The v-t graph shows that curve A is always above curve B until t1.
conclusion: The area under the curve for A is always greater than the area under the curve for B up to t1.

conclusion: The difference in displacement between objects A and B is continuously increasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
